metadata.title: CVE-2022-32893 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds write issue was addressed with improved bounds checking.This issue is fixed in iOS 15.6.1 and iPadOS 15.6.1, macOS Monterey 12.5.1,Safari 15.6.1. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead toarbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue mayhave been actively exploited.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-32893` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.37.91-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.37.91-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.37.91-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.37.91-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.37.91-1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.37.91-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.37.91-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.37.91-1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
